author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Halloween Readings Oct. 29
text:
Halloween Readings Oct. 29 Oct 16, 2015 Maine writers Katherine Silva and Peter Dudar, pictured at a previous year’s reading in Bath, will be joined by their creepy-tales cohorts Thursday evening, Oct. 29, at Rock City Café in Rockland. 
Rockland — Everyone is invited — dared? — to come and celebrate a fourth year of literary murder, mayhem and magic as a collection of Maine authors read from their most diabolical Halloween stories. 
This year's Rockland night of the Midcoast Halloween Readings features authors Peter Dudar, John Manderino, Jen Blood, Duane Coffill and Katherine Silva reading (and drinking some seriously good coffee) Thursday, Oct. 29, from 6 to 8 p.m. at Rock City Café, 316 Main St. 
Each writer will read for 10 to 15 minutes from one of their own works, genres ranging from cozy mysteries to supernatural horror to spine-tingling thrillers. For more information, contact Silva at info@voxthebook.com. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
